meanings.definition: To put something down in a horizontal position.
meanings.sent1: She layed the book on the table gently.
meanings.sent2: The cat layed down on the warm blanket.
meanings.sent3: He layed the toy car on the floor, pretending it was a real car.
meanings.sent4: The sun layed its golden rays across the field.
meanings.sent5: The artist layed out the colors in a beautiful pattern.

meanings.sent1: The hen layed eggs every morning.
meanings.sent2: The bird layed its eggs in the nest.
meanings.sent3: The chef layed out the ingredients for the omelette, as if they were eggs.
meanings.sent4: The tree layed its seeds in the fertile soil.
meanings.sent5: The factory layed out thousands of eggs for packaging.

meanings.definition: To place something in a particular position or location.
meanings.sent1: She layed the vase on the shelf carefully.
meanings.sent2: The teacher layed the map on the wall for everyone to see.
meanings.sent3: The child layed out his toys in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: The gardener layed the seeds in the soil, ready for growth.
meanings.sent5: The architect layed out the blueprints for the new building.
